p: Microbicides are new products being studied that contain drugs that prevent vaginal or rectal transmission of HIV via sexual exposure. These microbicides can take the form of vaginal rings, gels, films, inserts, or enemas, aimed at preventing HIV or STIs. Several studies over the past decade have examined the safety and efficacy of such preventative measures. A clinical trial conducted in 15 sites across Southern and Southeastern Africa showed that a vaginal ring which continually released the ART drug Dapivirine, provided a modest level of protection against HIV infection in women. [ 75] Similar trials testing the safety and efficacy of a Dapivirine ring found overall effectiveness to be around 31%. [ 75] Further studies are being established which examine the effectiveness of rectal microbicide gels to reduce the risk of HIV transmission through anal sex.
